result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Banks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs, victim witness surcharge, and DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.   Balance to be paid by April 20, 2018.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence. To commence forthwith.

superMiscConds.notes:
Successfully complete:  a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program, and a parenting program.
No license suspension.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens ad breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay  related surcharge. 
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use  or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Banks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Banks in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Daniel Banks in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 99 days.  Sentence to commence forthwith. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by April 20, 2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by April 20, 2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
-no license suspension

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarcertion Credit

Defendant Daniel Banks in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Daniel Banks in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 4/20/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Daniel Banks not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 3/11/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION with drug testing, absolute sobriety, no possession or use of controlled substances, no firearms/dangerous weapons.

Defendant Daniel Banks in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Daniel Banks in custody.  David J. Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for STATUS on 2/2/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Email sent to Jan at the PD's Office notifying her of case being calendared for Return on Warrant and the need to determine if defendant qualifies for public defender representaiton.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($1,000.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.

Attorney Megan L Morrisey in court.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Daniel Banks in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties need another pretrial date for further invetigation.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Banks in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Banks in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  William Levins for Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel Banks
Current: 3034 W State Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 04-03-2014)
Prior: 507 West Meinecke Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53223

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daniel Banks in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/3/14 @ 1:30pm
